title: Understanding $$f(x-a)$$
text: For some value a, $$f(x-a)$$ means that f(x) is translated to the right by a units. Similarly, $$f{\left(x+a\right)}$$ means that f(x) is translated to the left by a units.

title: Understanding $$f(x-a)$$
text: Since a is $$-3$$, $$h{\left(x+3\right)}$$ means that the graph is translated left by $$3$$.

title: Understanding $$a f{\left(x\right)}$$
text: For some value a not equal to $$0$$, $$a f{\left(x\right)}$$ means that f(x) is stretched vertically by a. Similarly, $$\frac{f{\left(x\right)}}{a}$$ means that f(x) is compressed vertically by a.
speech: For some value a not equal to  0 ,  a f of x,  means that f(x) is stretched vertically by a. Similarly, , fraction, f of x, over a,   means that f(x) is compressed vertically by a.

title: Understanding $$a f{\left(x\right)}$$
text: Since a is $$2$$, $$2h{\left(x+3\right)}$$ means that the graph is stretched vertically by $$2$$.
